extendedIngredients.name: deep dish pie crust
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (9 inch) deep dish pie crust, baked

extendedIngredients.name: pineapple in juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 20 oz can of crushed pineapple in juice, undrained

extendedIngredients.name: vanilla extract
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract plus Â½ teaspoon for meringue

recipes.title: Pineapple Sour Cream Pie

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco Dolce, Late Harvest Riesling, and Vin Santo are great choices for Pie. These wines are all sweet, which is important since wine should usually be sweeter than the food you're pairing with it. You could try Snake River Late Harvest Riesling. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Snake River Late Harvest Riesling
productMatches.description: Made from the grapes left to hang on the vine in our estate Arena Valley Vineyard, Late Harvest Riesling is our original dessert wine. Our 2011 has a limeade nose with a hint of minerals and a honey finish. Enjoy this wine with fruit based desserts or as a refreshing aperitif.

recipes.instructions: Separate the eggs. Put whites in bowl of stand mixer. Put yolks in a separate mixing bowl, then whisk them a bit and cover. Let stand for 30 minutes to come to room temperature.In a heavy saucepan, combine the 1/2 cup sugar, flour, pineapple and sour cream. Turn on the heat and cook and stir over medium heat until bubbly and hot. Whisk about half of the sour cream mixture into the egg yolks, then whisk egg yolk mixture into the saucepan still set over medium. Cook and stir until you hit a gentle boil, then continue cooking and stirring for two minutes.Transfer hot filling to a baked 9 inch pie crust and immediately cover with meringue.To make meringue, beat the egg whites until soft peaks start to form and gradually add sugar, cream of tartar and vanilla.Set the meringue covered pie on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 F. for 15 minutes or until meringue is lightly browned. Let cool at room temperature for an hour, then chill for 3 to 6 hours or until ready to cut.

steps.step: Separate the eggs. Put whites in bowl of stand mixer. Put yolks in a separate mixing bowl, then whisk them a bit and cover.

Let stand for 30 minutes to come to room temperature.In a heavy saucepan, combine the 1/2 cup sugar, flour, pineapple and sour cream. Turn on the heat and cook and stir over medium heat until bubbly and hot.

Whisk about half of the sour cream mixture into the egg yolks, then whisk egg yolk mixture into the saucepan still set over medium. Cook and stir until you hit a gentle boil, then continue cooking and stirring for two minutes.

Transfer hot filling to a baked 9 inch pie crust and immediately cover with meringue.To make meringue, beat the egg whites until soft peaks start to form and gradually add sugar, cream of tartar and vanilla.Set the meringue covered pie on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 F. for 15 minutes or until meringue is lightly browned.
Let cool at room temperature for an hour, then chill for 3 to 6 hours or until ready to cut.
